data.text: A Review of the Growtac Post Mount Equal Disc Brakes

So, some asked about these brakes when I posted pics of the new bike, and wanted some sort of review. At the time I'd only gone about 6 miles on them and couldn't make an honest assessment. However, after about 75 miles on them I can tell what I think to date. The brakes are the Growtac Equal in the Very Berry red. I purchased them on the Velo ORANGE site (I will include the link below). The ones I bought are the post mount mechanical brakes, and retail for $390 (US). No, they are not cheap. Yes, they work incredibly well. The brakes come with everything you need. I have mine set up using the compressionless cables. I am not a small roadie type. I'm 6-05 and weigh about 350 lbs. That means it takes a lot of work to stop this mass of ass when bombing down hill, and these brakes do just that. I have yet to need to fully lock them down because they do such a good job of slowing me at speed. I've used other mechanical brakes systems such as the Avid BB7's, which I like and have on another bike I own. In fact, I was going to put the BB7's on my Velo Orange, but I decided to go big and use the Growtac's instead. Going big meant dropping some hefty cash too. I paid more for these than for my Shimano XT hydraulic brakes. That being said, the Growtac's also actually do a better job of stopping me than my XT's. They have great modulation, and I can feather them easily while on a big descent. Ultimately, you just need to ask yourself what it is you want, and what fits your needs. I wanted a solid mechanical brake setup to run with dropbars, and these fit the bill. #growtac #veloorange https://velo-orange.com/collections/brakes/products/growtac-equal-brakes-post-mount?variant=41254387679407
